name: On The Day Before Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 3 | 10 Questions

questions.text: How long had Donald Dolan been working in the White House?
questions.explanation:
Two weeks.

	When Mr. Kovaleski walked in to the Office of the Executive Clerk's, Donald nervously told Mr. Kovaleski that it was the end of his second week. Mr. Kovaleski gave Donald the death tax bill to hand to the President of the United States.

questions.text: Who told CJ she was a lively conversationalist?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	CJ learned everything she could about the man that she was sitting beside during the dinner. Toby told her if the man wanted to talk about where he's from, where he went to school, and what his name was then she would be fine.

questions.text: The President vetoed the death tax bill.
questions.explanation:
True.

	When Dolan brought the bill to the President, he vetoed it in front of Leo, Josh, Toby, Sam, CJ, and Dolan.

questions.text: When Nancy told Leo about the café fire in Jerusalem, how many students did she say were from America?
questions.explanation:
2.

	The two American students that were killed in the fire were 19 and 21 year old brothers Ariel and Noah Levy in Jerusalem for a soccer match. They were killed by a group called the Palestinian Freedom Front. When the President talked to the family, he said he had three daughters and didn't know what to say.

questions.text: Where was the Governor from that Josh met in the Mural room during the Nobel Prize dinner?
questions.explanation:
Indiana.

	Josh was meeting with Gov. Jack Buckland to see if he was going to run for President in the next election. Josh offered him Labor Secretary if he would back out of running for President.

questions.text: Who was the last to talk to Charlie about taking immunity for his part in the MS scandal?
questions.explanation:
Leo.

	Sam was the first member of Senior Staff to approach him about it and Leo was the last. Charlie didn't want to take immunity because he felt that it would hinder the trust between him and the President.

questions.text: After a press briefing, why did CJ pull Sherri Wexler's press credentials?
questions.correct: She mentioned CJ's wardrobe changes during her broadcast
options: She made fun of the President
She mentioned Charlie's immunity during her broadcast
questions.explanation:
She mentioned CJ's wardrobe changes during her broadcast.

	CJ explained to Sherri that she would have to call the White House every day to see if she could have her credentials back. CJ also mentioned the reason why she changed clothes before the press briefing was so she wouldn't announce the death of two American boys while wearing a evening gown.

questions.text: Did Donna tell Josh about her dates with Cliff Calley?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	This episode was submitted for Janel Moloney's Outstanding Supporting Actress nomination in 2002.

questions.text: Who told CJ what the chemical abbreviation for table salt was?
questions.explanation:
President.

	CJ was worried she wouldn't know what it was and the President told her.

questions.text: What did Josh tell the President the day before Yom Kippur was called?
questions.explanation:
Erev.

	While they were all sitting in the Oval Office waiting for the call from the Levy family, the President asked Toby what came on the day before Yom Kippur. Toby couldn't remember and Josh spoke up and said Erev.
